name: Snapper Fillets Provencal Style
keywords: leek, snapper, tomato, main course, summer
recipeIngredient: 2 cups peeled and chopped fresh plum tomatoes
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
1/2 cup fish broth or bottled clam juice
4 sprigs fresh thyme or 1 teaspoon dried
4 snapper fillets with skin on (about 6 ounces each)
2 tablespoons fresh basil or parsley chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a saucepan and add the garlic, leeks, tomatoes, fennel and turmeric. Season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, over medium heat about 3 minutes. Add the wine, broth, bay leaf, thyme and Tabasco. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes.

In a large skillet add the remaining tablespoon of oil, arrange the fillets of fish in one layer. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the leek-tomato mixture evenly over the fish fillets. Sprinkle the Ricard, cover and simmer for about 5 minutes or until cooked. Sprinkle with basil and discard bay leaf before serving.
